name: Venus
fun_facts: Venus is Earth's sister planet in size but a hellish world.
Venus rotates backward (retrograde rotation) compared to most planets.
A Venusian day is longer than its year.
Venus has the hottest surface temperature of any planet.
The atmospheric pressure on Venus is 92 times that of Earth.
Venus is the brightest planet in our night sky.
description_short: The hottest planet with a toxic atmosphere and backward rotation.
description_long: Venus is Earth's closest neighbor and second planet from the Sun. Despite similar size and mass to Earth, Venus has become a hellish world with surface temperatures hot enough to melt lead and atmospheric pressure crushing enough to require special spacecraft. Its thick atmosphere of carbon dioxide with sulfuric acid clouds creates a runaway greenhouse effect. Venus rotates backward relative to its orbit and spins so slowly that a Venusian day is longer than its year. Evidence suggests Venus may have once had oceans and been habitable billions of years ago.
